website_summaries.verdict: The Amazon Fire TV Cube's well-designed voice controls make it a superb alternative to a standard universal remote, especially for simpler systems.
pros: The Amazon Fire TV Cube lets you control power, input switching and volume on your TV, sound bar or AV receiver hands-free from across the room, using only voice commands
You can also use your voice to change channels on a cable box
The microphones are superb at recognizing voice commands from afar, over the blare of speakers
Device control setup is as simple as possible
cons: If you want to use a source device beyond Fire TV -- like your cable DVR, game console, smart TV, Roku or Apple TV -- you'll have to keep its remote on-hand
The included Fire TV remote can't control other devices and even lacks volume and mute keys
Many apps don't support voice yet

customer_reviews.title: Wait for bugs to be fixed.
customer_reviews.text: Video playback pauses randomly quite often. It's only for one or two seconds, but it happens a lot. One time it would not respond at all to voice command. I unplugged it then powered back on and it worked again. I think it will be a great device once the bugs are worked out. I recommend waiting at least several months before purchase to see if the reviews get better when more updates come out.
customer_reviews.author: rodo

customer_reviews.title: The Fire TV Cube is a great idea, being able to control the TV with ...
customer_reviews.text: The Fire TV Cube is a great idea, being able to control the TV with your voice, but the execution is terrible. I have a Samsung TV hooked up to an Onkyo receiver, AT&T U-Verse cable box with several other gaming consoles and streaming devices. Installation was a headache, trying to configure and reconfigure inputs because Fire TV Cube can't seem to connect to the right one. Often you'll hear audio but a different video output is on or the other way around. I had a hard time making things work the first time and am still running into problems several weeks into the install. Today is Prime Day, I wouldn't recommend buying one at this time.
customer_reviews.author: CapsLock

customer_reviews.title: Makes life so much easier
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it!! I liked my Fire Stick just fine but I'm so happy I upgraded to the cube. It's so easy to use. It's been barely a month since I bought it and I dont even remember the last time I had to find a remote for anything. They are all on the shelf under the coffee table collecting dust... plus with Alexa's help there is nothing you can't find, do, or learn.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Goodyear

customer_reviews.title: How did this get approved and shipped?
customer_reviews.text: The Fire Cube is nothing short of a disappointment. It's performance pales in comparison to the Fire 4K (Pendant Style) and is not stable. The problems reported by others of maybe 2-3 second pauses while it thinks about returning to the home screen (no matter if that's what you wanted) are present for me as well. I've seem additional wonkiness when I ask the Fire Cube to turn off my AV receiver and TV. When they come on, the audio is not right and the input may not be last used. This device might be salvageable with updates, but why buy now and deal with it all? Get the regular 4K and call it good.
customer_reviews.author: Stucco

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have waited to get it
customer_reviews.text: While it is nice to use voice control, it is tough to navigate with just your voice. I use this as my main streaming device and primarily watch hulu and netflix and use the remote a lot out of pure ease. It also shuts off randomly and I have to unplug it and plug it back in to be recognized. I have a brand new lg TV and it wont sync with it to control the volume. It's a huge nightmare. Hoping some updates will come and make this better in the future, right now it's not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: The cube, great buy
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing the cube, I had and still have the stick. The cube thusfar has been great! I have added control to all my electronics that I have on my entertainment system. Tv, soundbar , xbox, blue ray, playstation, and cable. I just tell Alexa to turn on my TV or whatever electronic I have and works seemlessly. I have also added a couple of my lights and alarm system to it. The mic works great! Even with the sound up I can still say commands without muting the volume. It has double the ram with direct ethernet connection lagging is a thing of the past. Well worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Arljr

customer_reviews.title: not ready for prime time!
customer_reviews.text: not nearly as good as my roku, although as an Alexa freak i was hoping to have her stream my TV too. There is no way to insert a home theater amplifier. I also had to remove my Echo from the room, since you can't have two Alexa units in the same "command range" so you give up the great fidelity on the Echo speakers. Alexa on the Fire can do the same things as she does on the Echo of course, but the music is just poor by comparison. I returned it in favor of the roku ultra.
customer_reviews.author: The Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Device
customer_reviews.text: I think this device is great and I do not understand all the negative reviews. If you set the device up properly you will not have issues. It turns on and off my LG TV, DirecTV receiver, Sony surround system and living room light with just one command! It also changes channels, adjust volumes, switches inputs with Alexa commands and a lot more. Set all those remotes aside and use your voice, no batteries required. Some reviews say it loses its smartness after a while, not the case here. My Cube has been working fine from day one and I’ve had it nearly a month.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it...yet. Needs way more works.

I’d blame the tv but we had an Apple TV connected to this tv for years and it worked fine. It’s this device. The other shocking issue: the Amazon Prime video app is limited and awful to use on this device. But on the Apple TV it’s seamless. I love the idea and was ready for an upgrade but it looks like Apple is shocking me here and provide a far superior product at this time. I’ll be returning for a refund.

customer_reviews.title: Device whose time has not yet come.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first of 9 Alexa devices that did not delight me. I have not gotten it to successfully work with DirectTV. It doesn’t hear me from across the room. DirectTV uses RF for remotes but the box requires IR which makes the remote slow to useless. There is ZERO documentation on using it with satellite systems like Direct. I hope they do some Near-term updates and get issues like this resolved. I’m trying to decide whether to wait for updates or send the 119 dollar paperweight back.

customer_reviews.title: D-I-S-A-P-P-O-I-N-T-E-D
customer_reviews.text: I have an Echo, Echo2, Dot, Dot2 and a Tap in a 5 room condo. Was thrilled to add the FireTV Cube. The thrill didn't last long. It doesn't change channels, it doesn't turn the cable box off. Spent almost 2 hours on the phone with tech support, who bumped my complaint up. The next guy succeeded in getting my TV to tune into radio stations (yeah, huh?) So that guy told me he'd call back in 24 hours. When he called back he successfully had me using the buttons on the remote and said he call back the next day. It's been 10 days and nothing. So tomorrow, I'm packing it up and returning it. I am EXTREMELY DISMAYED.

Please email me or call me with the specific explanation or instructions to solve this problem, i'm still having to use the remote when I go to my channels....which was the whole idea of getting this, my wife has problems seeing and this is the perfect solution. Thanks.

The TV Cube sits on the same shelf as the AV receiver and I am not using the IRDA extension. Alexa can also shut all 3 devices off when asked "Alexa, turn the TV off".

Unfortunately recently it throws the yellow light constantly and becomes unresponsive and it intermittently loses internet connection. I have tried factory resetting, clearing cache, restarting and everything else to no avail. I have to manually unplug it several times a day reply it in and wait about 5 minutes for it to find a connection, even though the connection settings say it is connecting to the internet. It was a 5 star product before the issues arose and it does not appear to have a long warranty.

Sure, Amazon can now surveil our basement, and Alexa is sometimes a little snotty, but the Cube has improved our scarce evening leisure time by making it simpler.

I’m actually quite happy with my Echo and four echo dots I have throughout my home. The Cube has been a frustrating disappointment.

Just wish I could connect it to Multi-Room Misic so I could have music playing off my tv and other echo devices at the same time.

While some of the basic commands work ("Alexa, Turn On TV"; "Alexa, Watch Netflix"), it is really hard to navigate within the app. So far, here are the commands that DON'T work while watching Amazon Prime videos: - "Turn On Captions" - "Turn On Subtitles" - "Show Options" - "Return to Episode Menu" I really think that these commands should work. They don't seem too difficult or outrageous for a smart TV device to know. Hence, only 3 stars.

customer_reviews.title: The voice command thing is pretty good. Setting up other entertainment equipment is very ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a mixed bag... The voice command thing is pretty good. Setting up other entertainment equipment is very easy to do. But if you use it mainly as a Plex client then it's not a very good one. If Plex home is set up with multiple users, it will present the login prompt every single time you go back to the app. It can handle the regular 1080P, AC3 codec without issues, but it's very picky about playing 4K contents, most of time will just present a black screen. It also won't properly display HDR in Plex. The Nvidia Shield TV is able to play 4K and HDR contents properly without transcoding and it came out 2 years ago.

customer_reviews.title: Wait until they actually get this thing invented.

Sometimes the sound synchronization problems persist, making the cube almost unusable. Perhaps a firmware update in the future will fix this. Also some more random bugs that the Fire TV it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Good to go
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this Fire TV Cube on prime day I was uneasy about it, the top reviews were absolutely hammering the product for different technical reasons. However, I decided to take a gamble on it assuming that any software issues can be worked out in the coming days/months as with any new product. So Far, I am on day 5 of owning this product, and the gloom and doom I was expecting has yet to come. While there are some very minor issues to be worked out, I am overall satisfied with the product, and I hope you will be too.
customer_reviews.author: michael l.

customer_reviews.title: Not Ready For Prime Time
customer_reviews.text: 3 Stars might be a little generous, I think Amazon bit off more than it could chew with this product. It has had several hiccups, some apparently fixed with firmware updates some not. The main reason for the low review is how poorly the Silk Browser integrates with YouTube TV. There are too many issues to detail but suffice it to say it is almost useless and extremely frustrating and if I understand correctly in order to use Firefox involves some workarounds, looking at getting a Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Toys4Boys

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Crap
customer_reviews.text: This device is absolute crap. I set it up with my LG TV and Sony sound bar. When I ask it to play music, it always switches off the sound bar. I have Hawaiian Telcom, which at least half of the entire state has for their cable service, but the cube doesn't support it. I primarily bought the cube so I can control my TV and tell it to change channels and such. Currently the cube acts as a redundant smart device on my already very smart TV. Totally worthless.
customer_reviews.author: V. Lawn

customer_reviews.title: I think Amazon released this device before fully testing it out.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this device, but there were a dozen problems with it that caused me to return it. Worst of all, somehow it screwed up my Marantz receiver. I thought the receiver was completely broken, malfunctioning like it was possessed by a demon, but it only started happening when I hooked up this Amazon device, And stopped when I removed the device and reset the whole system. I think Amazon released this device before fully testing it out.
customer_reviews.author: Elektrodread

customer_reviews.title: Going to write this off to not thinking before buying
customer_reviews.text: I am just unhappy with this. When I tell it turn down the TV volume, It turns off the TV. When ever I ask to do something it mutes what I am watching until It is finished with what I asked it to do. If you ask it to turn up/down the tv volume if it works, it just does it a preset number of volume levels. You can not say set the TV volume to volume level 5, it just will not work. well it is now in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Pete In Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Works great for controlling audio/video equipment
customer_reviews.text: Love the audio/video equipment control function, works great. I’ve always had a problem controlling my audio equipment from one source even when using $100 Logitech Harmony universal remotes. So far the Fire Cube easily handled switch between Samsung TV, Marantz Preamp, Xbox, Apple TV, Roku and cable. Now everyone in the family can easily watch and control all of the equipment without problems. Also big plus it outputs audio in Dolby Atmos when available. Plus it automatically signed into apps from my cable provider (HGTV, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: JohnA

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awful Way Overpriced for Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: Only giving 1 star because that is lowest option. Bar none the absolute WORST Echo product I've ever encountered. Lasted 2 months then stopped maintaining a connection to the internet, wouldnt respond st all to commands, and basically did nothing except cost us $130 for a worthless piece of malfunctioning crap. Tried to return it but Amazon instead insisted on an "Amazon tech chat" which did nothing. Save your money and do not buy this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: GA Girl

customer_reviews.title: Channel changing limitation
customer_reviews.text: The cube will most likely be a hit with most people, but has limitations to my specific situation. It cannot control the cable TV channels with my mom's system in her nursing home. You have to have a cable box. Her cable comes through her wall from an unknown location. Amazon tech people did a great job trying to fix our situation. They figured out selecting antenna instead of an hdmi or cable or TV setup was what worked to switch over from streaming to regular cable. It is unfortunate channels cannot be switched, which was our biggest need. We can at least do things that couldn't be done before like on/off, volume, and playing streaming movies and TV.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Fontaine

customer_reviews.title: Audio stopped working a few months after the warranty lapsed.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a lot for me to give a product a ONE-STAR RATING. But when the product ceases to perform its basic functions after only a few months, that'll do it. I just bought a new television because the audio stopped working on the old one. When I couldn't get any sound out of the new one, I circumvented the Amazon Fire Cube. Like magic, my audio works again. Happy with the new television, but I'm pretty upset that Amazon sells products that fail so quickly. They're supposed to be a brand you can rely on. I'll be contacting customer service to lodge a complaint.
customer_reviews.author: tutorMATT

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS - many bugs.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS! This was my first “Alexa” product, and although I think other echo devices are good - this one sucks. It has a multitude of bugs. Set up was easy, but then the problems started. The cube randomly pauses while steaming Netflix, Hulu, and other apps, for no reason. It also randomly exits outs apps entirely and goes back to the home screen - then is unresponsive to commands. Volume control is buggy as well - volume ranges from app to app. I will be returning this item after 1 month of trying and being very unhappy with this product. Amazon should have tested this more before releasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Brawner

customer_reviews.title: I got sucked into the hype
customer_reviews.text: Well, I got sucked into the hype, ordering this It's too late for me to return it. My only hope is Amazon has an urgency and huge team working on this and can fix my 'dustable'. As many others have documented, the FireCube is not even near ready for the masses. If your considering the Fire Cube... pay attention to the reviews. I just hope the Fire Cube is not another Google Glasses debacle.
customer_reviews.author: Jo King

customer_reviews.title: Close but no cigar
customer_reviews.text: Update. 3 months later Amazon announce a newer version with improved remote. Not entirely happy about that. ---- Purchased for $90, not sure I'd pay full price. As mentioned by others, you need to learn Alex's vernacular and what seems intuitive to ask needs to be said in Alexa speak. Seems hobbled in that it can switch inputs to a DVD or Blu-ray player but it cannot switch to the input for OTA antenna. This is definitely not a hands free experience. Perhaps a future firmware update will add this functionality. If it does I'll up my rating. I have other TVs but I would only purchase additional Cubes if more functionality starts to show up.
customer_reviews.author: Howardsternisbatman

customer_reviews.title: Alexa do something. Ok..........*freezes*
customer_reviews.text: Multiple generations later and this is complete garbage. Almost daily I need to reset the box to receive commands. I owned a gen 1 fire tv and that thing was ol' reliable. customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good at streaming, but wish voice control integrated better with all the apps

The voice integrates well with the Amazon Prime and Hulu video content, but kind of blows with SlingTV. With SlingTV you have to 'manually" search for stuff rather than asking Alexa to do it for you. The mating iPhone remote control app has a ways to go too. It provides a keyboard for you to type, but it often doesn't work or doesn't work the way you expect it to. The great thing about a cloud-based device like this is that it can improve and get more features over time.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Wynia

customer_reviews.text: But it did not perform the basic commands. I bought for the main purpose of turning on my soundbar with my TV, as my dog chewed up the soundbar remote. The TV would turn on every time but the soundbar would only turn on after I asked multiple times. I called customer support and some adjustments were made, which fix it for a day but the next day I was back to asking numerous times. This was a deal breaker for me, so I sent it back. I will say that once the soundbar was on Alexa did her job of muting and turning volume up or down, but that is pointless if she cannot consistently turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Best Automation Yet

These are amazing, they understand the user, work as described and when linked to the other audio equipment it becomes seamless. One of the largest opportunities for older individuals is the frustration they feel with technology, by setting this up to interface with their existing things the user has control and that control goes a long way for the quality of life for the individual. Would recommend this for everyone. - Also, with the additional features coming soon it will allow for even more flexibility and independence
customer_reviews.author: kkursar

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but getting closer

The remote/mic works very well, but does the same things as the box does on a few commands. Set up was incredibly simple. I’m not sure why they were unable to incorporate features found on my other Alexa devices (Echo, Dot, Show) like calling. Maybe they will soon have an update for it. Playing around with it has been a bit of a learning curve since it has limited instructions. I guess they want you to go online for instructions. Basically I have no major issues. Will wait to see how they make it better.

The unit identifies Playstation and Fire TV, so you can tell Alexa to switch to Fire Tv, etc, and it switches to the appropriate input. Tell Alexa to set the temperature to 70 (Nest), done. Alexa, turn off the bedroom lights (wifi plug), done. The ONLY thing I wish we could do is add it to the "everywhere" group for music out of the soundbar. But this is not an Echo, though the buttons on the top resemble one. Perhaps Amazon will add that functionality.

The downfall is that we cut the cable years ago and use OTA for local programming - and the cube doesn't support OTA. I can't even get it to switch to the ANT/Cable input via voice. Seems to be a significant miss for this version - hopefully it will be rectified with a software update. But - if you have a cable box, you should be just fine!

It will just close whichever app is in the middle of playing a show, restart the show and it will do it again until you restart the whole thing. I’ve had it just over 2 years and it shouldn’t be this bad.

Does a good job of finding shows on Hulu, Netflix and Amazon. It will switch to a channel by number or network name on my cable box

Unfortunately, anything more complicated - such as changing channels, changing inputs, or pausing/playing Netflix shows - is an exercise in patience (and more often futility). Success rate for those commands is about 20%, and inevitably requires at least 4 attempts. I'm hopeful that future updates and software tweaks will eventually provide better behavior. Until then, the Fire Cube is barely more than a novelty.

product_meta.title: Fire TV Cube (1st Gen), hands-free with Alexa and 4K Ultra HD and 1st Gen Alexa Voice - Previous Generation
feature_bullets: Fire TV Cube is the first hands-free streaming media player with Alexa, delivering an all-in-one entertainment experience. From across the room, just ask Alexa to turn on the TV, dim the lights, and play what you want to watch.

With far-field voice recognition, eight microphones, and beamforming technology, Fire TV Cube hears you from any direction. Enjoy hands-free voice control of content—search, play, pause, fast forward, and more. Plus control the power and volume on your TV, sound bar, and A/V receiver as well as change live cable or satellite channels with just your voice.
